name: sfchronicle
text:
“It definitely didn’t seem like a normal day at the ballpark."

The @SFGiants returned to Oracle Park for their first workout of “summer camp” to prepare for a truncated season, a strange first glimpse of pandemic baseball.

https://t.co/tLmRvWRzr0

name: sfchronicle
text: The @Athletics are still searching for an alternate training site for players not invited to their Oakland camp. Stockton's ballpark is being considered, but the team is aware of rising coronavirus cases in San Joaquin County. https://t.co/QjEyY52MoQ

name: sfchronicle
sfchronicle
text: Eight burning questions about the Giants' first day of "summer camp" training, answered by @ScottOstler: https://t.co/T0IvJxqhTs

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: COVID-19 hospitalizations hit new peaks in Bay Area this week, with the nine counties reporting nearly 500 patients. https://t.co/FKMeWfGkfV

name: sfchronicle
text:
The A’s and Giants are working to schedule at least two exhibition games against each other prior to the start of the abbreviated MLB season later this month.

https://t.co/ftE9m3QYnK

name: sfchronicle
text: Two more Death Row inmates at San Quentin died Friday after testing positive for COVID-19, bringing the death toll to four as the prison struggles with 1.400 infections among prisoners, and roughly 100 among staff. https://t.co/swd6al6m2t

name: sfchronicle
text:
Kimberly Guilfoyle, former first lady of San Francisco and the girlfriend of Donald Trump Jr., tested positive for the coronavirus shortly before President Trump’s event at Mount Rushmore. She is a key fundraising official with the Trump campaign.

https://t.co/hDgUC8Vgpq
